case_vignette:
A 1-year-old boy presents with a single, L-shaped, yellow-orange hairless patch over the left preauricular skin. The patient’s mother notes that he has never grown hair in that location. The mother is concerned because the area used to be smooth, but seems to be changing. The patient has a history of prematurity and low birthweight but is otherwise healthy. The patient has no relevant social or family history. The patient’s mother is a 30-year-old woman who is otherwise healthy. The patient’s father is a 35-year-old man who is also otherwise healthy. The patient’s mother is concerned that the hair loss may be related to the patient’s prematurity and low birthweight. The patient’s mother is also concerned that the hair loss may be a sign of a genetic disorder. The patient’s mother is worried that the patient may have a condition that is passed down from the patient’s father.

I have a single, L-shaped, yellow-orange hairless patch over the left side of my face near my ear, and I've never grown hair in that location.

Final Diagnosis: Nevus Sebaceous
